text: [Music]
this is one of the most volcanically
active regions in the world this entire
landscape you can see the evidence of
countless eruptions but now scientists
say is time to tap into the power of a
volcano and they're drilling into the
heart of one this projects been planned
for years it's going to be the hottest
borehole in the world
the drilling started back in August
beginning its descent deep underground
it's already passed through thick layers
of volcanic rock and at 2,500 metres it
hits 300 degrees Celsius this is the
point that most conventional bore holes
stop but this one has gone deeper
heading towards 5000 meters down that's
three miles where it's expected to hit
500 degrees here water mixes with molten
rock and becomes what's known as
supercritical steam it's neither a
liquid nor a gas but it holds far more
energy than either and it's this that's
going to be brought back up to the
surface scientists think it will
generate so much electricity it could
transform the energy industry
some other team are doing at the moment
is changing over the different parts of
the drill there's so much of it actually
quite thin as you can see and here we
actually have the drill bit it goes
blunt as it's powering through
all of those many layers of volcanic
rock so they're constantly having to
change it but there's so nearly there
they've almost reached 5,000 meters
below the earth they should be there in
the next few weeks
